page.title: 10Population & Lifestyle
page.content: This is a very rural area with small static local populations. The hamlet of Sewell has only about 30 houses and the villages of Stanbridge (pop. 827) and Tilsworth (pop. 358), although consisting of some London commuters, are mostly settled by locally employed newcomers from areas with higher housing costs. These are mostly middle class villages with few council properties. There is not a particularly high church attendance except for the usual annual festivals. As shown by the size of the village school there is not a very large younger generation: this is due partly to the high cost and scarcity of local housing which in turn is due to fast access by the M1 to London and lack of sewerage facilities to enable extensive building. The restaurant at the Five Bells ...
